questions.question: When did Jamaica gain full independence from Britain?
Which country invaded and occupied Timor-Leste in 1975?
What is the practice of acquiring political control over another country, occupying it with settlers, and exploiting it economically called?
Which Bob Marley song is specifically mentioned in the module for comparison with Timorese resistance songs?
When was slavery abolished in Jamaica?
What year did Timor-Leste achieve full independence?
Which of the following was NOT a key figure in Jamaica's nationalist movement?
What event in Timor-Leste's history occurred in 1991 and is mentioned in the module?
Which music genre developed in Jamaica in the 1960s and became associated with the independence movement?
What role did music play in both Jamaica's and Timor-Leste's independence movements?
choices: It was banned by colonial authorities
It was used as a tool for unity and morale
It was only popular among the elite
questions.answer: It was used as a tool for unity and morale

choices: By preserving Timorese identity and language
questions.answer: By preserving Timorese identity and language
